skill.name: paypal-integration
skill.description: Integrate PayPal payment processing with support for express checkout, subscriptions, and refund management. Use when implementing PayPal payments, processing online transactions, or building e-commerce checkout flows.
skill.summary: Integrate PayPal payment processing with support for express checkout, subscriptions, and refund man...

security_audit.summary: No data theft, obfuscation, or malicious execution patterns detected. Network usage is limited to documented PayPal APIs in example code. Scope aligns with PayPal integration guidance.

content.value_statement: You need a clear PayPal payment flow with secure verification. This skill provides practical patterns for checkout, IPN, subscriptions, and refunds.
actual_capabilities: Explain PayPal checkout flow with client and server roles
Outline IPN verification and event handling steps
Describe subscription plan and approval flow setup
Detail refund creation and refund lookup patterns
Recommend error handling and sandbox testing steps
limitations: Does not provide PayPal credentials or create accounts
Does not deploy or run code in your environment
Does not cover legal or tax compliance requirements

use_cases.title: Add PayPal checkout
use_cases.description: Map a checkout flow with order creation, capture, and server verification.

use_cases.title: Launch subscriptions
use_cases.description: Plan subscription plans, approval URLs, and renewal handling.

use_cases.title: Handle refunds
use_cases.description: Document refund steps and status checks for support playbooks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic checkout plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a simple PayPal Express Checkout flow with client steps and server verification.

prompt_templates.title: IPN handler outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a Flask IPN handler outline with verification steps and duplicate protection.

prompt_templates.title: Subscription setup
prompt_templates.prompt: List the API steps to create a plan and subscription, and return the approval URL.

prompt_templates.title: Refund workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe the server steps to issue a partial refund and retrieve refund details.

output_examples.input: Give me a PayPal IPN verification checklist for my backend.
output: Receive POST data and preserve all fields
POST data back to the PayPal IPN endpoint
Log and ignore duplicate transaction IDs

best_practices: Use sandbox mode for testing and validation
Make PayPal endpoints and credentials configurable
anti_patterns: Trusting client callbacks without server verification
Processing IPN messages without idempotency checks

faq.question: Is this compatible with the PayPal REST API?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance uses PayPal REST endpoints for checkout, subscriptions, and refunds.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and patterns only. It does not run code or configure your PayPal account.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing backend?
faq.answer: Yes. The steps are framework agnostic and can be adapted to your stack.

faq.question: Does it access or store my payment data?
faq.answer: No. It does not access files, credentials, or external systems.

faq.question: What should I do if IPN verification fails?
faq.answer: Check endpoint URLs, required parameters, and network errors, then retry in sandbox.

faq.question: How does this compare to a full SDK integration?
faq.answer: It explains flows and patterns, while SDKs provide runnable client libraries.
